name: Status quo
text: Primary Energy is ... Therefore it accurately describes the actual energy needed. The scenario close to what our world looks like today, assumes a consumption of xy next year, 2020. That is x times more than the measured amount in 20xx and x times more than in 19xx.

name: Energy Types
text: Primary Energy [originates] either from fossil carriers (f) like Oil or Coal or from non-fossil carriers (nf) that e.g. include Solar and Biomass but also Nuclear energy. The consumption in 2020 is projected to consist of mostly fossil carriers.

name: Future
text: Projected into the future (2100) the energy consumption more than doubles. This assumes no further climate policies. The shares of fossil and non-fossil energy carriers remain nearly the same.

name: Possible Futures
text: Four other futures are possible. In every possible future the total energy consumption and shares of fossil and non-fossil energy carriers varies.

name: The Paris Agreement
text: The Paris Agreement’s climate target is to keep the increase in global average temperature to well below 2°C. In order to achieve these target it needs i.a. a shift in the mix of fossil and non-fossil carriers.

name: Middle of the Road
text: In the possible “Middle of the Road” future, in which the climate target 2°C is achieved (through further climate policies), the share of fossil carriers is much lower and the share of non-fossil much higher than in the equivalent future without any further climate policies.

name: Energy Carriers
text: Let’s take a closer look at the energy carriers. Fossil and non-fossil energy carreirs can be further subdiveded.

name: Climate Target 2°C
text: This detail view visualizes the differences of energy volumes between the possible “Middle of the Road” future and its equivalent in which the climate goal 2°C is achieved.

name: The Green Road
text: Should a sustainable world (“The Green Road”) develop, climate targets can be achieved fairly easy. It would need only a modest carbon price to meet the 2°C target. The meeting of climate targets therefore requires less effort and might receive stronger support.

name: Carrier Oil
text: Let’s take a closer look at the energy carrier Oil and its development over the years. Even in a sustainable world (“The Green Road”), Oil will continue to be used extensively until 2050.
